quotes: Years active 2003–present
He is best known for the Indonesian action crime films Merantau (2009)
Evans cast Uwais in his 2009 film Merantau
He is best known for the Indonesian action crime films The Raid (2011)
He planned to produce a larger action film, but scaled the production budget down and created an action film called The Raid (2011)
He is best known for the Indonesian action crime films The Raid 2 (2014)
He is also known for co-creating, co-writing, co-directing, and executive producing the Sky Atlantic / AMC action crime drama television series Gangs of London (2020–present)
based on the 2006 video game of the same name
its sequel, The Raid 2: Berandal (2014).
In late 2016, Evans started working on his next film, Apostle, which stars Dan Stevens.
The film was released by Netflix on 12 October 2018.
In October 2017, TheWrap reported that Evans had pitched his idea for a Deathstroke solo film and is in early talks to write and direct.
However, in April 2020, Evans said that the film had been delayed and that he was no longer actively involved with the project.
In February 2021, it was reported that Evans signed an exclusive deal to produce and direct films for Netflix.
His first film under that deal was Havoc, starring Tom Hardy & Forest Whitaker, which was filmed in 2021.
the film was eventually given a release date of April 25, 2025.
Evans lived in Jakarta, Indonesia with his wife, Maya Barack-Evans, and their daughter, until the family moved back to Wales in 2015.

In November 2011, The Raid won the Midnight Madness Award at the Toronto International Film Festival in 2011.
